Articles.Content:
Hello beautiful people! I decided to go ambitious mode and make my own cockpit mod for KSP, from my favorite plane of all! And many others ahah.

I will post progress as i go but expect this mod to be in your hands soon!! (when i say soon, no promises but, in a week from now or so.)

Lets get straight to the point:

I went to 20 hours of boring tutorials on Blender, Sketchup, GIMP and Unity to make my small dream come true ahah

I definetly plan to do the IVA. After im finished this one, the Mig-21 is in my sights muahahah!

Cheers!

Don't forget to leave a comment! Your opinion is really important and encouraging

One more thing people, keep a notebook next to you in bed, never know what awesome ideas might pop up! (like mine)

PS: Sry for grammar mistakes, english is not my first language
very nice! You could use module jettison to add the "spine" behind the windows so it only appears when something is attached to the aft stack node, to smooth out the transition into the tail section.

Neat! Very much needed, very very much.

I would highly recommend doing it based off the Firespitter oblong fuselage shape rather than the round 1.25m shape. Last I checked, Bf 109s weren't barrel-chested...
Actually that is a very nice idea! But for now i will stick to Stock-Alike But definitely something to consider! Thanks!

Then would you consider making a radial-attach canopy, like the one in SXT?

As you can see there's no way to hide a 1.25m cylinder on a plane like this, let alone the even more streamlined Bf 109.
Dont worry, im planning on adding a part that you attach on top of fuel tanks in order to smooth out the canopy

surface attach cockpit is a great idea, perfect for airplanes... why ddint' I think of it myself!

Nevermind about modulejettison unless you have a stack node on it. the module does not like surface attach nodes one bit.

Edited September 16, 2014 by nli2work
Give. Just...Just give. I will name this the mod of 2014 if you include a spitfire cockpit and themed parts as well.
I had to redesign a bit of the front part and back of the cockpit to use less polygons, i reduced the count by alot! This makes for easier texturing and better colision mesh
I like it.

Very nice! Can't wait to play with it

My favorite plane is... Well, i don't even know if it can be classified as a plane, but its the Heinkel Lerche thing. Now, if we're talking about planes that look like planes, then the Go-229.

Since you said the BF-109 and the 21, and I have a feeling you have seen some of the DCS stuff and got inspired by it (Digital Combat Simulator for people who do not know, simulates planes).

Looks very nice btw, can't wait to use it.
Hey man, awesome job! I loved the Bf 109s back in the day, with those screaming superchargers. Anyway, are you planning to make more parts as time goes, like an engine or wings?

Then would you consider making a radial-attach canopy, like the one in SXT?

I second this. Anyway, nice job on the cockpit! It looks great! Looking forward to seeing what you do later.

Thank you everybody for you comments, you just inspire me to do more!

@SlimeCrusher - Yes i also love both the Go and the Lerche, i'l even do a lerche body, and when my skills are good enough....maybe even an engine Google the Focke Wulf Trieblfugel, you can build one in ksp with infernal robotics!

@Monkthespy You are going to use it! Soon!

@MangoScout Thanks mate! Why is the "love" verb in the past? ahah I do plan to make more! I just need to get a bit more skilled in these things, i just started!

@DisarmingBaton5 Thanks! I also look forward to see what i can build later, and YOUR reactions!

Hey if anybody can provide a few links/tutorials in building interiors and porting then, that would be the absolute best! Cheers guys and thanks for the comments! Keep'em comming!

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/45070

This IVA tutorial is still good. though without pictures it's a little hard to understand initially

http://imgur.com/a/Vd2Zn

I pulled some squad pods out with Parttools to get a sense of how the External and Internals are oriented relative to each other. may help clear up few things from TT's tutorial
Can't wait to couple this to an ICE Daimler Inline V12. It will make a very decent replica. As I said a Spit would be nice but an FW-190 one would be rather dapper as well.
Oh, yeah, which version of the 109 is your favorite? mine is the K-4 KurfÃƒÂ¼rst.

Oh, yeah, which version of the 109 is your favorite? mine is the K-4 KurfÃƒÂ¼rst.

Mine is also the K-4 because it's the fastest...but i like the G-6's cockpit better
Hmmm....there seem's to be a thingy in my dropbox....https://www.dropbox.com/s/n5mc9ethl7ikh1y/bf109prototype.zip?dl=0
It...begins

I went to 20 hours of boring tutorials on Blender, Sketchup, GIMP and Unity to make my small dream come true ahah

I definetly plan to do the IVA. After im finished this one, the Mig-21 is in my sights muahahah!

"Muahahah"... I haven't seen someone post/chat that sence my FighterAce days!!!!

LoL...

Will be keeping an eye on this one...

"Muahahah"... I haven't seen someone post/chat that sence my FighterAce days!!!!

LoL...

Will be keeping an eye on this one...

Ahahah keep both eyes on in then!

Mine is also the K-4 because it's the fastest...but i like the G-6's cockpit better

Ah, yes, the old cockpit in the G-6 does look good, but I really like the Erla Haube canopy in later G models and the K models.

http://static.flickr.com/54/144987310_c290b6aa84_o.jpg

Ah, yes, the old cockpit in the G-6 does look good, but I really like the Erla Haube canopy in later G models and the K models.

http://static.flickr.com/54/144987310_c290b6aa84_o.jpg

Yes! Nice cockpit indeed, alot more practical and the pilots see better! I chose this model to put in my mod because its more....bulky!
